skill.name: PPTX
skill.description: Presentation creation, editing, and analysis. When Claude needs to work with presentations (.pptx files) for: (1) Creating new presentations, (2) Modifying or editing content, (3) Working with layouts, (4) Adding comments or speaker notes, or any other presentation tasks
skill.summary: Create, edit, and analyze PowerPoint presentations with HTML-to-PPTX conversion, slide manipulation, and OOXML editing capabilities
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate PowerPoint presentation manipulation skill. The code safely processes user-provided .pptx files using standard Python libraries (python-pptx, defusedxml, lxml) and validates XML structure. The only external commands are to soffice for document validation, with proper subprocess security (timeouts, captured output). Uses secure XML parsing to prevent XXE attacks.

low_findings.title: External subprocess execution for document validation
low_findings.description: The pack.py script (lines 103-116) and thumbnail.py script (lines 219-243) use subprocess.run() to execute external commands (soffice, pdftoppm). However, this is for legitimate document processing with proper security: commands are hardcoded paths, use timeouts (10 seconds), capture all output, and validate file extensions before processing.

content.value_statement: Users need to create and edit PowerPoint presentations programmatically. This skill provides tools for HTML-to-PPTX conversion, slide manipulation, text inventory extraction, and OOXML editing for precise presentation control.
actual_capabilities: Convert HTML slides to PowerPoint with accurate positioning
Extract and analyze text inventory from presentations
Rearrange slides and duplicate template slides
Apply text replacements to existing presentations
Validate OOXML structure against XSD schemas
Create visual thumbnail grids of slide decks
limitations: Cannot edit embedded media or complex animations
Requires LibreOffice for PDF validation and conversion
Template-based editing limited to slide structure duplication
Cannot modify speaker notes or comments via HTML conversion

use_cases.title: Automated report presentations
use_cases.description: Convert HTML reports to PowerPoint slides for quarterly reviews and stakeholder presentations

use_cases.title: Template-based presentations
use_cases.description: Use company templates to create consistent branded presentations with slide duplication and reordering

use_cases.title: Document processing workflows
use_cases.description: Integrate PowerPoint manipulation into automated content pipelines and reporting systems

prompt_templates.title: Create simple slides
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PowerPoint presentation about quarterly results using html2pptx. Convert the HTML slides in workspace/slides/ directory. Use the design guidelines from html2pptx.md for color palettes and web-safe fonts. Save the output as quarterly-report.pptx.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze existing presentations
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract the text inventory from template.pptx using inventory.py. Save the results to template-inventory.json and analyze the slide layouts and placeholder structures for reuse.

prompt_templates.title: Modify template content
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new presentation from template.pptx using only slides 0, 2, 5, and 7. Then apply the text replacements from replacement-text.json to create output.pptx with new content.

prompt_templates.title: Validate and troubleshoot
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the edited presentation against the OOXML schemas. Run validation using soffice and fix any relationship ID or content type errors before repacking the final PPTX file.

output_examples.input: Create a 5-slide presentation about climate change using HTML slides
output: Slide 2: Bullet list with key statistics
Slide 3: Bar chart showing temperature trends
Slide 5: Summary and call to action

best_practices: Always validate XML structure after editing OOXML files before repacking
Use web-safe fonts (Arial, Helvetica, Times New Roman) for maximum compatibility
Create thumbnail grids to visually verify slide layouts before finalizing
anti_patterns: Skipping validation after XML edits (may produce corrupt PPTX files)
Using non-web-safe fonts that may not render on all systems
Ignoring placeholder boundaries when adding charts or images

faq.question: What file formats are supported for input and output?
faq.answer: This skill works with .pptx files. HTML input requires proper structure with text in p, h1-h6, ul, or ol tags.

faq.question: Are there limits on slide count or file size?
faq.answer: No inherent limits. Performance depends on system resources. Large presentations may require more memory for inventory extraction.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with other office tools?
faq.answer: Uses LibreOffice (soffice) for PDF validation. Works with PptxGenJS for HTML conversion and python-pptx for document manipulation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing presentations?
faq.answer: All processing is local. Scripts use defusedxml to prevent XXE attacks. External commands (soffice) have 10-second timeouts.

faq.question: Why does my presentation fail to open in PowerPoint?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing content type declarations, broken relationship references, duplicate IDs, or invalid XML structure. Run validate.py to identify issues.

faq.question: How does this compare to other presentation tools?
faq.answer: Unlike cloud converters, this runs locally with full OOXML control. Offers precise template editing that web tools cannot match.
